file_content.text: You would be wise not to interrupt me.
There is much to be done. My interests must be protected and my enemies destroyed.
Nomen Karr's efforts to expose my spies and prove his Padawan's power to the Jedi Council must meet with systemic failure. You will exhaust yourself in this charge.
I'm proud to serve.
What will it entail?
I'll enjoy this.
The information we siphoned from that Republic agent will be our map. We know my spy on Nar Shaddaa was being surveilled.
We know where this Padawan was discovered, where she trained, and that the Jedi have sent someone to investigate my spy on Balmorra.
The Padawan will have to be hunted down and destroyed, but first you must secure my network by silencing my spies on Balmorra and Nar Shaddaa.
Consider them wiped from existence.
I'll kill anyone you say.
Nothing less than that will be sufficient.
Why not simply recall your spies?
Silence them?
Their disappearance would look suspicious and serve to confirm the Padawan's accusations. My spies must die.
Is it wise to put off destroying the Padawan?
Can't the spies wait?
If the Jedi acquire proof of my spy network, Nomen Karr wins. We must mop up the potential leaks first.
My contacts on Balmorra and Nar Shaddaa will detail what must be done. Your tasks are paramount, apprentice. Bring cruelty. Bring rage. Bring death.
I don't know about you, but I'm inspired.
This is the beginning of greatness, Vette.
How could you not be?
Well, I guess I'm happy if you're happy.
You need to get with the program.
Grow up.
Guess that means we're not going for a joyride.
None of this is for your benefit.
Your mood doesn't matter.
Believe me, that's becoming painfully obvious.
So be it. I'm along for the ride, wherever it takes us.
Apprentice, I trust you find your starship satisfactory.
It's an outstanding vessel.
I do, master.
I hope that it serves you well.
I've seen better.
Not impressed.
If you want better, you'll learn to show appreciation.
I'll let you know after I've taken it for a spin.
How does it fly?
You are about to get that chance.
Waste no more time. Go to my hangar in the spaceport and claim your starship. I will contact you with your new orders.
Your duties are likely to take you to the far reaches of the galaxy. I will need to deploy you at will.
You shall have a starship of your own. You've earned it. Go to my personal hangar in the spaceport and claim it.
You are most generous, master.
You have my thanks.
You bet I've earned it. This is long overdue, Baras.
It's about time.
I'm the one who dictates the timing of such things.
Your starship has been moved to my personal hangar at the spaceport. And take this--it will enhance the vessel's power.
Thank you, master. It will be good to see my ship.
You are most kind.
Save your gratitude.
I'll head there immediately.
Right away.
Good, I can finally leave this jungle.
My galaxy is expanding.
You will go and come as I dictate.
I must ponder our next move. Waste no time. Get your starship in my hangar and wait for further instructions.
Yeah, uh, let's go before he tells me to clean all this up, okay?
When I sent you into the Dark Temple for the Ravager, I thought it might be the last time I saw you, apprentice.
It seems you are never in over your head.
I do what must be done, and always rise to the occasion, master.
All in a day's work.
Glad you're finally giving credit where it's due.
Thanks for noticing.
I trust you know how to show your appreciation.
I should be rewarded.
Your reward will be watching me use the device to ravage this man's mind.
The prisoner grows weaker by the minute. There's no time to spare. Stand back and bear witness.
You're wasting... your time. I... will... not... ahh!
Yes. The Ravager has seized his mind. Excellent! In his condition, we don't have long before the ordeal liquefies all brain matter.
He is the picture of torment.
Looks painful.
I endured his defiance for so long; it is a sight for angered eyes.
Maybe he'll last longer if you reduce the pain.
Go easy on him.
The pain drives the device's effectiveness.
I hope the results are gory and gruesome.
Make him bleed.
I do not care what we see, as long as I hear what I want.
Republic worm, you have the information I desire. Tell me everything.

I am... Republic... Information Service... on special assignment to verify... possible Imperial spy... on Nar Shaddaa. Commissioned by... Jedi Council... acting on suspicions provided by... Master Nomen Karr....
Nomen Karr. That's a name I grow tired of hearing.
What's the problem? Who is Nomen Karr?
Why?
One of your enemies, I take it.
A Jedi?
My oldest and most hated enemy. An old wound that continues to fester.
Are you going to keep me in the dark, old man?
Don't beat around the bush.
Nomen Karr is a Jedi Master who infiltrated the Sith. I rooted him out, then he nearly destroyed me and fled.
He's dedicated himself to proving that the Sith have spies imbedded within Republic and Jedi ranks. I've thwarted him at every turn. But he is tenacious.
His failure is a testimony to your power.
Just keep thwarting him.
And yet, he was somehow on the brink of exposing my spy network.
Sounds like a worthy adversary.
He must be strong.
Worthy of contempt and malicious destruction.
He can't be tenacious if he's dead.
There's one way to stop him.
I will celebrate the day that Jedi nuisance is no more.
How did Nomen Karr come to suspect my spy on Nar Shaddaa? Tell me, Republic wretch--what alerted him?
Master Nomen Karr has... a new... Padawan. She seems to... know any being's... true nature. She senses... hidden darkness... and... untapped purity....
Astonishing. I've never heard of the Force granting such a gift. Tell me, how does her power work?
All I... all I know is... when Master Nomen Karr brought her to Nar Shaddaa... this Padawan sensed... darkness in your spy... simply by... seeing him.
This is a serious threat.
Sounds bad.
It is the doom I felt--the disruption in the Force.
What's a "Padawan"?
Padawan?
That is what the Jedi call their trainees. It means she is not yet a Jedi.
Seems far-fetched to me.
I don't believe it.
I have witnessed many unlikely things in my lifetime, apprentice.
If this young Padawan can see through deception and disguise with such little effort, she threatens everything I have worked for. Continue, Republic dog.
Karr... believes his Padawan's... ability... is foolproof... but the Jedi Council is... skeptical. I was... to provide the proof... but... I wasn't... able... to report my findings....
The damage is not yet done.
You're safe, master.
For now, perhaps. But we can't have this potential doomsday weapon scouring the galaxy.
We must know more about this Padawan.
That's not enough to go on.
We have to kill this Jedi in training.
She must be stopped.
Yes, my apprentice. Such a threat must not wander the galaxy unchecked.
Who is this Padawan, you Republic pest? Tell me everything you know about her.
She was found... on Alderaan...! Her power... first emerged... training on... Tatooine. And... Jedi sent another... agent... to investigate someone she suspected on Balmorra....
He's fading. Is she human or one of the Jedi's cursed aliens? Where can I find her? What is her name?
I... have... nothing... no... thing... mo... mo--argh!
The Ravager has emptied his mind. That is all we have to go on, a few random places within the greater galaxy where Nomen Karr and his Padawan have been.
It's a start, master. That device did the trick.
We are no longer in the dark.
You are correct. We now have leads to follow.
Spotty details at best. We have our work cut out for us.
It's not much.
Send me to find this Padawan.
I'll hunt them down.
You mirror my thoughts, apprentice.
Nomen Karr is a relentless crusader, and this Padawan and her unprecedented power threaten everything I have achieved.
Your efforts have provided me with a foothold, my apprentice. For that, you must be rewarded.
Service is its own reward, master.
Not necessary.
That attitude is why you succeed.
I was hoping you would say that.
You read my mind.
You will find I am a generous man--when pleased.
You state the obvious. Make it good.
I've earned this.
Keep in mind, anything I give can be taken away.
I swear, I will find a new apprentice if you do not make haste and search the Dark Temple for the Ravager. Immediately.
Now, back to my prisoner. There's one last possibility to break him. I thought it impossible, but perhaps there's a small chance you could pull it off.
I'm here to serve however you see fit.
At your command, master.
Can't wait to hear it. I'm on pins and needles.
I'm dreading this.
That can be arranged, apprentice. Sharp pins and rusty needles.
This had better be good, Baras.
Just tell me.
Over a millennium past, the Emperor claimed Dromund Kaas and made the Dark Temple the epicenter of dark Force energy.
In the bowels of the temple, he conducted horrifying experiments that drained the knowledge and life essence from all the greatest Sith Lords of the time.
He destroyed his own lords?
His allies?
They existed to serve their master--and that they did. He siphoned them to make himself immortal and all-knowing.
Sounds like my kind of guy.
Good man, the Emperor.
I'm sure that he would be relieved to hear that you approve.
Is there a point?
The Emperor created a device called "the Ravager" that ate his victims' minds and delivered to him their greatest secrets.
No one could withstand the Ravager's intrusion--even the strongest Sith Lords of the Empire confessed whatever the Emperor craved.
Where can the Ravager be found?
And its location?
I'm sure the Emperor has the best toys.
Must be nice to be in charge.
I wouldn't call the Ravager a toy, apprentice. It's not to be taken lightly.
Let me guess, you want me to get the Ravager.
I know what I'm doing next.
It may be my only chance to break this Republic worm.
The Emperor keeps the Ravager hidden in the Dark Temple, which has, in his absence, become a death trap.
You have not blinked at my assignments and proven yourself up to every task. If anyone can retrieve the Ravager from the Dark Temple, it's you.
Your faith is not misplaced. Consider the device yours.
I will succeed, master.
What can I expect to face in the temple?
What awaits me?
It's unknown. Some time ago, there were many Sith with Imperial crews excavating the temple's treasures--when suddenly all went quiet, and none returned.
Since then, those who enter and survive go mad, returning with tales of awakened spirits and phantom guardians. It will be harrowing.
I'm not afraid, master.
Nothing disturbs me.
Don't deny fear, apprentice. It can be a powerful asset. Learn how to utilize it.
I like a challenge.
Everyone gets killed by something.
It's a good day to die.
There's a good chance the horrors that await you will be too severe. But it's worth your life to me.
Are you asking or commanding?
Do I have to?
You are my minion. I am never asking.
The legends describe a secret chamber in the depths of the Dark Temple where the Ravager was encased. You'll know the device by its inscription. Be swift, apprentice.
Argh! I cannot break him!
I feel your anger, master.
Must be infuriating.
A blind, deaf, comatose, lobotomy patient could feel my anger!
Trouble, master?
Who would ask such a stupid question? Clearly there's a problem here.
Nice lungs you got there.
You sure can scream.
Mind your tongue, or I will cut it out!
Okay, I'm officially scared.
This is impossible. An unknown power must be shielding this man, which only confirms my suspicions.
This Republic agent is the key to unlocking the threat we face. I must harness my rage and frustration. They will lead me to an answer.
Be persistent. I'm sure you will find a way.
I have no doubt.
Your encouragement is noted, my apprentice.
Trust your feelings, master.
Look inward.
Ha! The minion advises the master. Very good, you demonstrate your progress.
Wake me when you figure it out.
I grow impatient.
Your insolence will one day be your undoing. I would punish you if I wasn't so pleased with your progress.
And the word has spread that Lord Grathan is incensed at the slaying of his secret son. I take it that was your handiwork.
After dealing with his son, I stayed to socialize with Lady Grathan. An added humiliation for him.
Plus, I seduced his wife.
Ah, my young apprentice, you have just cheered me up.
I'm still feeding off the adrenaline.
It was a thrill.
Let it fuel you, my potent agent of darkness.
Indeed.
It was a simple feat.
My confidence in you is growing.
I haven't heard from Dri'kill Ba'al, my agent in Grathan's camp. He's missed a scheduled communication. Let me guess--he gave you trouble, did he?
He gave me no trouble at all.
He was a pushover.
Ha! I can sense the truth behind your words, apprentice. Ba'al can be replaced.
He left me no choice, master. I had to kill him.
He sealed his fate.
I bled him dry and danced on his corpse.
I relished killing him.
Eh, no matter. He fulfilled his primary purpose. Every Sith must attempt to orchestrate his own promotion.
I am busy with this prisoner! Go to Lord Grathan's compound and meet with my agent Dri'kill Ba'al.
I'm still trying to extract the information I crave from this Republic agent. He's much more resilient than anticipated.
He'll crack, master. I'm sure of it.
It will work.
I will not rest until he does.
Utilize me.
All I require is time. Just leave me to my work.
I thought you said you were good at this.
You're getting soft.
Now is not a good time to test me, apprentice.
Even as I brutalize him, I twist the Force to keep him alive and feeling every sensation.
That is the cruelest thing I've ever heard.
I have another important task for you. It involves a renegade Sith Lord named Grathan. A particularly bothersome thorn in my side.
Meet with my apprentice, Dri'kill Ba'al. He's my covert operative in Grathan's compound. Ba'al claims to have made a key discovery.
Do you know the nature of this discovery?
What did he find?
Ba'al only communicates in predetermined signals. He was to find Grathan's exploitable weakness, and today he sent the success signal.
I thought I might be your only apprentice. That makes Ba'al my rival.
Another apprentice?
Try to tolerate him long enough to get the details and conclude your business there.
Invading a Sith compound is my kind of work.
I look forward to it.
Grathan's presence is useful to me, so I don't want him killed, just crippled. Find out what Ba'al has discovered and do exactly as he instructs.
Today I cripple a Sith Lord.
I hope to face Grathan.
Enjoy it. One day it won't seem so special.
Is your other apprentice above me in the pecking order?
Am I Ba'al's subordinate?
I'm sure he views himself as your better, but he has merely been here longer.
Too bad. I would love to kill a Sith Lord.
Grathan's lucky.
No doubt someday you will have your chance to try--one way or another.
Now then, Republic wretch, where were we? Oh yes....
Tell--me--what--I--wish--to--know!
I--I don't care what you do. Break my bones, burn my flesh--I'll tell you nothing!
I will not be denied!
Ah! Argh! G--g--g--g--go s--s--s--s--s--spit, you m--m--m--monster!
I didn't know bodies could bend like that. I think I'm gonna be sick!
Such treatment awaits you if you disobey.
You could be next.
Makes that shock collar seem tame, doesn't it?
You've got it good, slave.
Spare yourself. You shouldn't have to see this.
Turn away, Vette.
Grow a little backbone or don't look.
Toughen up.
Don't empty your stomach on my boots.
Do it somewhere else.
The more you resist, the more angry I become! And the longer I'll torture you after I get what I want from you!
Ah, apprentice, you've returned. Commander Pritch confirmed that the slaves have been silenced. Good.
Torturing this Republic operative requires privacy, apprentice. You need to meet with Commander Pritch in the jungle. Go now.
Now, while I thaw the prisoner and painfully siphon every morsel of information I can from him, I have some concerns that require your special talents.
Tell me what I must do.
I am ready, master.
I'd like to stay and watch the torture, my lord.
Can't I observe your work?
Oh yuck, please, no.
You can watch me torture the next prisoner.
I crave more action, so let's get on with it.
Good. No more waiting around.
No rest for the wicked, I guess.
Go to the Imperial post in the jungles outside the city. Commander Pritch is stationed there. He has a seek-and-destroy task for you.
Right away.
What will I be seeking and destroying?
Tell me more.
Do not needlessly tax me. Commander Pritch will supply all the details.
I don't take orders from lackeys.
Don't I outrank Pritch?
Pritch is merely relaying information, apprentice.
I must tend to the torturing of this miserable Republic agent.
Waste no time. I have more for you to do once this is complete. You are dismissed.
Lanklyn informed me of the ambush at the cargo port. Apparently, there are more eyes on us than even I thought.
It's a good thing you didn't fail, or else this prisoner--this crucial puzzle piece--would have been lost.
Did you doubt me, my lord?
Were you worried?
If I doubted your abilities, I would not have sent you.
Why is the prisoner so important, master? He doesn't look like much to me.
Puzzle piece to what?
You've earned the right to know.
I wouldn't want to think you'd risk my neck frivolously.
Better be important.
That is what your neck is for. To risk as I see fit.
You should be proud of your accomplishment today. Our very existence hung in the balance.
I have felt a disturbance in the Force. It leaves doom imprinted on my dreams--a grave and mysterious threat that could bring down my entire power base.
I'm listening. What's the nature of this threat?
You have my attention.
Presently, I do not know.
Must be dread indeed to have you so concerned.
Sounds bad.
What you sense from me, apprentice, is venom, bile, disdain. When something rises to confront me, I meet it with all my rage and passion.
I had no idea you were prone to such exaggeration.
You're so dramatic.
Assume, apprentice, that I never exaggerate.
This frozen man is a top Republic agent, captured while investigating my most deeply imbedded spy on Nar Shaddaa--one of my "invisibles."
The Force grants me a vision of doom, and immediately, my untraceable spy--who has left no footprints, no trail--is almost exposed. It makes me furious.
It could just be a coincidence, master.
We don't know they're related.
It is not coincidence. I can feel it.
Maybe your spy wasn't so invisible after all.
Guess there was a trail.
Do not presume to tell me my business. There's no profit in it.
Instead of whining, do something about it?
Stop wasting time.
Oh, I'll do something about it, one of the things that I do best--torture.
I must learn what tipped off the Republic agent. He is the key to uncovering the nature of this threat.
Waste no time, apprentice. Meet Commander Lanklyn in the cargo port and make sure he and his men successfully off-load my prisoner. Go.
A military starship is touching down at the Kaas City cargo port, delivering a vitally important prisoner to me.
You will meet Commander Lanklyn there and make sure he and his men successfully off-load this prisoner.
If you're sending me, you must be expecting trouble.
Could there be entanglements?
It will be my honor.
This is beneath my talents. Commander Lanklyn can't handle it himself?
Sounds like a menial task.
Lanklyn is competent. But that is moot.
We must always assume that we are being plotted against. Especially when the stakes are high.
At every turn we must be ready to act, and to thwart those who seek to weaken us. And we must do so decisively. Do you understand?
Understood.
Thwarting is among my greatest skills, and I do everything decisively.
I'm completely qualified.
I'm banking on that, apprentice.
It's not a difficult concept. I'm not stupid, Baras.
Why wouldn't I?
And I leave nothing to interpretation.
The importance of this prisoner cannot be overstated. Go to the cargo port now, and stay sharp. You are dismissed.
Not a minute too soon. Your timing is impeccable.
Did it just get considerably colder?
I see you decided to keep the slave. I hope she amuses you.
Welcome, my new apprentice. Dromund Kaas is the base for all of my most important operations, so consider it your new home.
I understand you killed my welcoming committee.
It had to be done. He taxed me.
I couldn't stand him.
He was an annoying little creature. No matter, he can be replaced easily.
It was an accident, my lord. My hand slipped.
I didn't mean to.
We are no longer at the Academy on Korriban. You are Sith. You can claim the cold-blooded murders you perform here.
Simply because it amused me.
For fun.
You're fortunate that it also amuses me.
Killing him has not angered me. With such a disagreeable weapon at my side, many will think twice before crossing me.
I trust you've been acquainting yourself with your new environs. Did my minion point you in the right direction?
His pointer finger was a bit twitchy.
He seemed nervous.
A by-product of constantly fearing for his life. But it keeps him in line, doing the trivial tasks that need tending to.
He's a dutiful servant who lives to serve you.
Yes, he did his job well.
A properly beaten-down slave is the only trustworthy creature in the galaxy.
That runt is utterly useless.
He's a waste.
Everything has a use.
Those who serve me all know their place. But you may find my other apprentices somewhat unappreciative of your presence.
Your responsibilities will mandate contact with my various minions. Meet my directives, and you may do as you will to anyone you encounter, adversary or ally.
I work best when unrestrained.
Good.
You can trust that I'll use good judgment, master.
I'll be discreet.
Sounds liberating--the ability to kill anyone I want.
Time for a murder spree.
A lightsaber can only achieve so much, apprentice. The most powerful weapon in a Sith master's arsenal is information.
I have painstakingly built a vast network of spies and operatives embedded throughout the Sith, Republic and Jedi alike. I have fingers, eyes and ears everywhere.
Which am I to be--a finger, eye or ear?
What's my role?
You've successfully infiltrated the Jedi Order?
The Jedi? Really?
Yes. My operatives are completely undetected, and I wish to keep it that way.
I track our enemy--weakening and influencing them from within. Waiting to strike.
Tell me, why don't you trust your own allies?
You spy on Sith?
Some of the greatest threats come from within. Within every friend, there is a fiend.
A Sith has many rivals who seek to destroy him. We're an opportunistic culture. We rise by dismantling those around and especially above us.
You're my enforcer--deployed to protect my interests, intimidate my rivals and destroy my enemies. It's time for your tenure to begin.
What is your bidding, master?
Command me.
Well bred. Tremel was right about that, at least.
I've always wanted to be deployed.
Sounds like fun.
Well, today your wish will be fulfilled.
Sounds like I'll be doing everything. What would you do without me?
That's a big job description.
I'll take your tone to indicate anticipation as opposed to insolence.
You have not been summoned to my chambers. Exit the way you came, if you know what's good for you.
